Class ServerPoller

  • java.lang.Object
    • catana.ServerPoller

  • public class ServerPoller
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    djoshuac This class tells a CLIENTSERVER to update the client model at a regular interval.

    • Method Detail

      • changeServer

        public void changeServer(server.IServer server)
        Parameters:
        server - - the server you want the poller to poll
        Precondition:
        server must not be null
        Postcondition:
        The server that is polled is changed to the given server. This works even if the poller is currently running.

      • start

        public void start(long delay,
         long period)
        Delays, and then starts a timer to poll the server at regular intervals.
        Parameters:
        delay - - delay in milliseconds before the polling of the server should begin
        period - - delay in milliseconds between each poll to the server
        Precondition:
        delay must nonnegative, period must be positive, System.currentTimeMillis() must be nonnegative, and the clock used for Object.wait() must be accurate
        Postcondition:
        After the delay, the CLIENTSERVER will be polled periodically. This will override any previous calls to start

      • start

        public void start(long period)
        Starts a timer to poll the server at regular intervals.
        Parameters:
        period - - delay in milliseconds between each poll to the server
        Precondition:
        period must be positive, System.currentTimeMillis() must be nonnegative, and the clock used for Object.wait() must be accurate
        Postcondition:
        After the delay, the CLIENTSERVER will be polled at the given period. This will override any previous calls to start

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts a timer to poll the server at regular intervals.
        Precondition:
        System.currentTimeMillis() must be nonnegative, and the clock used for Object.wait() must be accurate
        Postcondition:
        The CLIENTSERVER will be polled every second. This will override any previous calls to start

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops polling the server.
        Precondition:
        none
        Postcondition:
        Polling to the CLIENTSERVER is stopped

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        You can use this 'main()' to see how the poller will work. All I need to finish this class is to implement the 'run()' method of the UpdateModelTask class. #UMT-RUN
        Parameters:
        args - - we do not use this here
